sections.faq:
How often should I apply it?
Apply Mosquito Deleto every 14 days in regions with higher precipitation, or every 28 days for drier areas.
Apply Ant Adios every 2 to 4 weeks as bait is consumed.
Should I treat my entire lawn?
Rather than covering the entire lawn, designate a “protected zone” in the area where you spend the most time. Spray this zone regularly.
How do I apply it?
It's best to apply Ant Adios first and let it get to work for a week before applying Mosquito Deleto repellent. If you use them at the same time, avoid spraying repellent where you laid the ant bait.
Scatter Ant Adios on soil around or near plants in need. Avoid applying over flowering plants when pollinators are present!
Spray Mosquito Deleto in an up and down motion, working quickly to cover your protected lawn area, trees, mulch, and bushes until all foliage is just fully wet.
Should I use these products before or after Sunday nutrients?
You can apply either one first—the order is totally up to you! Regardless, you’ll want to wait 24 hours between those applications to avoid washing out or diluting either formula.
What's the difference between Mosquito Deleto and Nix Ticks?
Mosquito Deleto is a repellant with a strong lemongrass oil formulation to target mosquitos.
Ant Adios is bait containing spinosad, a naturally occurring soil-dwelling organism that attacks the ant's nervous system.
Are there any US states or territories where Mosquito Deleto and Ant Adios are not approved for use?
Mosquito Deleto is not yet approved for use in the following states and territories: DC, ID, IN, MD, ME, MS, MT.
Ant Adios is approved for use in all states.
